description: The storage domain inventory dashboard include storage domain inventory list and disk usage

panels.content: ###### This dashboard include inventory list and disk usage for the selected storage domain.

panels.description: This report displays a inventory list of all storage domains of the selected data center.

targets.rawSql:
--BR47 - This query returns for a specific datacenter, the storage domains list,
-- along with their configuration details, available disk size, 
-- used disk size and total, up to an hour back.
-- storage_domain_type and storage_type will be returned in localised session language.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT
    storage_domain_name,
    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id,
    a.value AS storage_domain_type,
    b.value AS storage_type,
    available_disk_size_gb, 
    used_disk_size_gb,
    ( available_disk_size_gb + used_disk_size_gb ) AS total_size,
    create_date,
    delete_date
FROM 
    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains
    INNER JOIN v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id =
                v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains.storage_domain_id
                -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                AND v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains.datacenter_id =
                    CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS uuid )
                -- Here we get the latest map
                AND v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains.history_id 
                    IN 
                        (
                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                            FROM v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains a
                            GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id, a.datacenter_id
                        )
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN 
        (
            SELECT
                enum_translator.enum_type,
                enum_translator.enum_key,
                enum_translator.value
            FROM enum_translator
            WHERE language_code = 'en_US'
        ) AS a
        ON 
            (
                storage_domain_type = a.enum_key
                AND a.enum_type = 'STORAGE_DOMAIN_TYPE'
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN 
        (
            SELECT
                enum_translator.enum_type,
                enum_translator.enum_key,
                enum_translator.value
            FROM enum_translator
            WHERE language_code = 'en_US'
        ) AS b
        ON 
            (
                storage_type = b.enum_key
                AND b.enum_type = 'STORAGE_TYPE'
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN 
        (
                SELECT history_datetime, storage_domain_id, history_id, available_disk_size_gb, used_disk_size_gb 
                FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_samples
        ) AS samples
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id =
                samples.storage_domain_id
                AND samples.history_id 
                    IN 
                        (
                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                            FROM             
                                (   
                                    SELECT history_datetime, history_id, storage_domain_id 
                                    FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_samples
                                ) AS a    
                            GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
                        )
            )
WHERE
    -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
    $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id IN ($storage_id)
    -- Here we filter by the storage type chosen by the user
    -- If "All" storage types were chosen by the user then the
    -- parameter "P_Storage_Type" equals to -1
    AND storage_domain_type IN ($domain_type)
    -- Here we get the storage domain latest configurations
    AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.history_id 
        IN 
            (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains AS a
                GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
            )
    -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
    -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
    AND
        CASE
          WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
          WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN delete_date isnull
        END
ORDER BY storage_domain_name

--BR47 - This query returns for a specific datacenter, the storage domains list,
-- along with their configuration details, available disk size, 
-- used disk size and total, up to an hour back.
-- storage_domain_type and storage_type will be returned in localised session language.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    storage_domain_name,
    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id,
    a.value AS storage_domain_type,
    b.value AS storage_type,
    available_disk_size_gb, 
    used_disk_size_gb,
    ( available_disk_size_gb + used_disk_size_gb ) AS total_size,
    create_date,
    delete_date
FROM 
    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains
    INNER JOIN v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id =
                v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains.storage_domain_id
                -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                AND v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains.datacenter_id =
                    CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS uuid )
                -- Here we get the latest map
                AND v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains.history_id 
                    IN 
                        (
                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                            FROM v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains a
                            GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id, a.datacenter_id
                        )
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN 
        (
            SELECT
                enum_translator.enum_type,
                enum_translator.enum_key,
                enum_translator.value
            FROM enum_translator
            WHERE language_code = 'en_US'
        ) AS a
        ON 
            (
                storage_domain_type = a.enum_key
                AND a.enum_type = 'STORAGE_DOMAIN_TYPE'
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN 
        (
            SELECT
                enum_translator.enum_type,
                enum_translator.enum_key,
                enum_translator.value
            FROM enum_translator
            WHERE language_code = 'en_US'
        ) AS b
        ON 
            (
                storage_type = b.enum_key
                AND b.enum_type = 'STORAGE_TYPE'
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN 
        (
                SELECT history_datetime, storage_domain_id, history_id, available_disk_size_gb, used_disk_size_gb 
                FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_hourly
            UNION
                SELECT history_datetime, storage_domain_id, history_id, available_disk_size_gb, used_disk_size_gb 
                FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_daily
                WHERE
                    history_datetime <
                        (
                            SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_hourly
                        )
        ) AS hourly_daily
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id =
                hourly_daily.storage_domain_id
                AND hourly_daily.history_id 
                    IN 
                        (
                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                            FROM             
                                (   
                                        SELECT history_datetime, history_id, storage_domain_id 
                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_hourly
                                    UNION
                                        SELECT history_datetime, history_id, storage_domain_id 
                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_daily
                                ) AS a    
                            GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
                        )
            )
WHERE
    -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
    $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id IN ($storage_id)
    -- Here we filter by the storage type chosen by the user
    -- If "All" storage types were chosen by the user then the
    -- parameter "P_Storage_Type" equals to -1
    AND storage_domain_type IN ($domain_type)
    -- Here we get the storage domain latest configurations
    AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.history_id 
        IN 
            (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains AS a
                GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
            )
    -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
    -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
    AND
        CASE
          WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
          WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
              THEN delete_date isnull
        END
ORDER BY storage_domain_name

panels.title: Storage Domains Inventory (BR47)

panels.description: This report displays average available disk size for the selected data center and storage domain over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR21 - This query returns for a specific storage domain
-- the average available disk size per hour over the chosen period.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.history_datetime),
    COALESCE 
        (
            storage_domain_name,
            MAX ( storage_domain_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ),
            ''
        ) AS storage_domain_name,
    available_disk_size
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime,
            AVG ( available_disk_size_gb ) AS available_disk_size
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, available_disk_size_gb, storage_domain_id 
                FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples,
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains
        WHERE
            -- Here we join the storage domain configurations table with the statistics table
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id =
            samples.storage_domain_id
            -- Here we filter by the storage domain chosen by the user
            AND samples.storage_domain_id IN ($storage_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest storage domain configurations
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains a
                        GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY sub_query.history_datetime

-- BR21 - This query returns for a specific storage domain
-- the average available disk size per hour over the chosen period.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.history_datetime),
    COALESCE 
        (
            storage_domain_name,
            MAX ( storage_domain_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ),
            ''
        ) AS storage_domain_name,
    available_disk_size
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime,
            AVG ( available_disk_size_gb ) AS available_disk_size
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, available_disk_size_gb, storage_domain_id 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, available_disk_size_gb, storage_domain_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily,
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains
        WHERE
            -- Here we join the the storage domain configurations table with the statistics table
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id =
            hourly_daily.storage_domain_id
            -- Here we filter by the storage domain chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.storage_domain_id IN ($storage_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest storage domain configurations
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains a
                        GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY sub_query.history_datetime

panels.title: Storage Domain Available Size (over time) (BR21)

panels.description: This report displays average used disk size for the selected data center and storage domain over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR21 - This query returns for a specific storage domain
-- the average used disk size per hour for the chosen period.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.history_datetime),
    COALESCE 
        (
            storage_domain_name,
            MAX ( storage_domain_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ),
            ''
        ) AS storage_domain_name,
    used_disk_size
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime,
            AVG ( used_disk_size_gb ) AS used_disk_size
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, used_disk_size_gb, storage_domain_id 
                FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples,
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains

            -- Here we join the the storage domain configurations table with the statistics table

            history_datetime

-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY sub_query.history_datetime

-- BR21 - This query returns for a specific storage domain
-- the average used disk size per hour for the chosen period.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.history_datetime),
    COALESCE 
        (
            storage_domain_name,
            MAX ( storage_domain_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ),
            ''

    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime,
            AVG ( used_disk_size_gb ) AS used_disk_size
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, used_disk_size_gb, storage_domain_id 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, used_disk_size_gb, storage_domain_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily,
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains
        WHERE
            -- Here we join the the storage domain configurations table with the statistics table
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id =
            hourly_daily.storage_domain_id
            -- Here we filter by the storage domain chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.storage_domain_id IN ($storage_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest storage domain configurations
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                    SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains a
                    GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY sub_query.history_datetime

panels.title: Storage Domain Used Size (over time) (BR21)

panels.description: This report displays used disk size versus available disk size ( total disk size ) for the selected data center and storage domain over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR21 - This query returns for a specific storage domain
-- the available disk size versus used disk size ( total disk size ), 
-- per hour for the chosen period.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.history_datetime),
    COALESCE 
        (
            storage_domain_name,
            MAX ( storage_domain_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ),
            ''
        ) AS storage_domain_name,
    used_disk_size AS "( Used disk size )",
    available_disk_size AS "( Available disk size )"
    --,( available_disk_size + used_disk_size ) AS "( Total disk size )"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime,
            AVG ( available_disk_size_gb ) AS available_disk_size,
            AVG ( used_disk_size_gb ) AS used_disk_size
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, available_disk_size_gb, used_disk_size_gb, storage_domain_id 
                FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples,
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains
        WHERE
            -- Here we join the the storage domain configurations table with the statistics table
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id =
            samples.storage_domain_id
            -- Here we filter by the storage domain chosen by the user
            AND samples.storage_domain_id IN ($storage_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest storage domain configurations
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains a
                        GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
    -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
    WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    ORDER BY sub_query.history_datetime

-- BR21 - This query returns for a specific storage domain
-- the available disk size versus used disk size ( total disk size ), 
-- per hour for the chosen period.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.history_datetime),
    COALESCE 
        (
            storage_domain_name,
            MAX ( storage_domain_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ),
            ''
        ) AS storage_domain_name,
    used_disk_size AS "( Used disk size )",
    available_disk_size AS "( Available disk size )"
    --,( available_disk_size + used_disk_size ) AS "( Total disk size )"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime,
            AVG ( available_disk_size_gb ) AS available_disk_size,
            AVG ( used_disk_size_gb ) AS used_disk_size
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, available_disk_size_gb, used_disk_size_gb, storage_domain_id 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, available_disk_size_gb, used_disk_size_gb, storage_domain_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily,
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains
        WHERE
            -- Here we join the the storage domain configurations table with the statistics table
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id =
            hourly_daily.storage_domain_id
            -- Here we filter by the storage domain chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.storage_domain_id IN ($storage_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest storage domain configurations
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains a
                        GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
    -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
    WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    ORDER BY sub_query.history_datetime

panels.title: Storage Domain Total Size (over time) (BR21)

panels.description: This report displays total used disk size for the selected data center and storage domain over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR21 - This query returns for a specific storage domain
-- the total used disk size per hour for the chosen period.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.history_datetime),
    COALESCE 
        (
            storage_domain_name,
            MAX ( storage_domain_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ),

-- BR21 - This query returns for a specific storage domain
-- the total used disk size per hour for the chosen period.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.history_datetime),
    COALESCE 
        (
            storage_domain_name,
            MAX ( storage_domain_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ),
            ''

    used_disk_size

    (
        SELECT
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime,
            AVG ( used_disk_size_gb ) AS used_disk_size
        FROM
            (

                    FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, used_disk_size_gb, storage_domain_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily,
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains
        WHERE
            -- Here we join the the storage domain configurations table with the statistics table
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id =
            hourly_daily.storage_domain_id
            -- Here we filter by the storage domain chosen by the user
            AND hourly_daily.storage_domain_id IN ($storage_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest storage domain configurations
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains a
                        GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY sub_query.history_datetime

panels.title: Storage Domain Total Used Size (over time) (BR21)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT  CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value, CASE     WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	    THEN datacenter_name 	when delete_date is not null  	     then datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')' END AS __text FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters WHERE      history_id          IN              (  	            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		        GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	        ) 	AND datacenter_id  	    IN 			( 			     SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 				 FROM v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains 			) 	AND 	   CASE  	       WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	           THEN 1=1 		   WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		       THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	   END
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT  CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value, CASE     WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	    THEN datacenter_name 	when delete_date is not null  	     then datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')' END AS __text FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters WHERE      history_id          IN              (  	            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		        GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	        ) 	AND datacenter_id  	    IN 			( 			     SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 				 FROM v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains 			) 	AND 	   CASE  	       WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	           THEN 1=1 		   WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		       THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	   END

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( storage_domain_id AS varchar ) AS __value, CASE     WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	    THEN storage_domain_name 	WHEN delete_date is not null  	     THEN storage_domain_name || ' (Detached on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')' END AS __text FROM      ( 		SELECT  		    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.*,  		    v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains.datacenter_id 		FROM 		    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains             LEFT JOIN              v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains             USING (storage_domain_id) 	) AS b WHERE      history_id          IN              (  	            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains a  		        GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id 	        ) 	AND datacenter_id IN ('$datacenter_id') 	AND 	   CASE  	       WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	           THEN 1=1 		   WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		       THEN delete_date ISNULL 	   END
list.label: Storage Domain
list.name: storage_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( storage_domain_id AS varchar ) AS __value, CASE     WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	    THEN storage_domain_name 	WHEN delete_date is not null  	     THEN storage_domain_name || ' (Detached on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')' END AS __text FROM      ( 		SELECT  		    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.*,  		    v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains.datacenter_id 		FROM 		    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains             LEFT JOIN              v4_3_map_history_datacenters_storage_domains             USING (storage_domain_id) 	) AS b WHERE      history_id          IN              (  	            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains a  		        GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id 	        ) 	AND datacenter_id IN ('$datacenter_id') 	AND 	   CASE  	       WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	           THEN 1=1 		   WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		       THEN delete_date ISNULL 	   END

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT           value AS __text,           enum_key AS __value FROM       ( 	 		SELECT        		    enum_translator.*,       		    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id      		FROM  	     		    enum_translator     		    LEFT JOIN 	         		    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains	     		    ON  	         		        (  			     					enum_translator.enum_key =  				 					v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_type 					AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.history_id 					    IN 					        (  								SELECT MAX (a.history_id) 								FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains a 								GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id 							) 				)  	) AS b  WHERE language_code = 'en_US'       AND enum_type ='STORAGE_DOMAIN_TYPE' AND storage_domain_id IN ($storage_id)
list.label: Domain Type
list.name: domain_type
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT           value AS __text,           enum_key AS __value FROM       ( 	 		SELECT        		    enum_translator.*,       		    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id      		FROM  	     		    enum_translator     		    LEFT JOIN 	         		    v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains	     		    ON  	         		        (  			     					enum_translator.enum_key =  				 					v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_type 					AND v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains.history_id 					    IN 					        (  								SELECT MAX (a.history_id) 								FROM v4_3_configuration_history_storage_domains a 								GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id 							) 				)  	) AS b  WHERE language_code = 'en_US'       AND enum_type ='STORAGE_DOMAIN_TYPE' AND storage_domain_id IN ($storage_id)
